column4: each of you guys have told him a different subnet ! ... one person told him use 192.1.168 ... you told him 192.168.0.  and he used 192.168.2.231 ... lol
i was making an example only
we dont know his network address
so we made examples with the most used network address based on a class C network, we didnt have enough info
.... if it is asking me for "root password for maintenance" that usually means the root account is enabled
then run the command you want with sudo or gksudo

you clearly haven't been paying attention to what is going on .... Authentication is broken buddy... Its depending on pam_ldap.so ... the system wide authentication system that lets you do sudo ... login as anything etc... is broken
ok then you need to compile the module or find a package with the module in
you can't just modprobe something if its not on your disk
Thats why i included "dpkg -l | grep toshset" in the pastie
then those packages do not not have the module in them do they
i'd read that launchpad link i gave, seems quite conclusinve in areas
